macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stock Futures Climb After Wednesday's AI-Driven Selling
items.summary: Futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.3%, S&P 500 rose 0.3%, and Nasdaq climbed 0.25% premarket following a session marked by artificial intelligence competition concerns. Global markets showed mixed results with Asian indexes mostly up and European financials steadying.

items.title: S&P 500 Shows Calm Surface but Building Technical Extremes and Volatility Risks
items.summary: The S&P 500 rallied early but faded gains amid a short-lived volatility crush, with VIX rising and indicators like VVIX and left-tail index signaling underlying nervousness. Elevated constituent volatility relative to index levels warns of potential corrections ahead of earnings season.

items.title: Lenovo Shares Drop on Weak Q3 Profit; SoftBank Swings to Profit on OpenAI Stake
items.summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng fell nearly 1% dragged by Lenovo's over 5% drop after weaker-than-expected third-quarter net profit. SoftBank Group reported a profit boost from its $4.2 billion stake in ChatGPT maker OpenAI.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz Earnings Drag Auto Stocks Lower in Europe
items.summary: Mercedes-Benz shares fell 4.3% after earnings release, pulling down peer automakers amid broader European market movements. Financial stocks in Italy and Spain advanced while London's FTSE 100 climbed 0.4%.

items.title: U.S.-Iran Tensions Lift Oil Prices as Second Carrier Group Deployed
items.summary: Escalating U.S.-Iran tensions, with a second U.S. aircraft carrier strike group sent to the Middle East, gave oil traders jitters and pushed crude prices higher.

items.title: Schroders Surges 30% on Nuveen Takeover Announcement
items.summary: Asset manager Schroders shares jumped nearly 30% after announcing it would be acquired by U.S. peer Nuveen, boosting London's market performance.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Under Pressure, Drops Below $68,000 Amid Weak Demand
items.summary: Bitcoin retreated sharply below 68,000 from a year-to-date high of 126,300, with futures open interest falling to $45 billion from $95 billion, signaling weakened demand. Technical indicators suggest further downside to 60,000 support level.

items.title: Hyperliquid Up 24% YTD, Recommended Buy Amid Crypto Rout
items.summary: Decentralized exchange Hyperliquid (HYPE) has risen 24% this year to an $8 billion market cap, ranking 12th largest crypto, with plans for new outcomes contracts to boost trading volume.

items.title: Pax Gold Stablecoin Up 16% as Gold Prices Rise
items.summary: Gold-backed stablecoin Pax Gold (PAXG) has gained 16% year-to-date, tracking rising gold prices, positioned as a strong investment amid broader crypto market declines.

items.title: Bitcoin May Trade Sideways Until Summer 2026 Due to Low Liquidity
items.summary: Bitcoin's 45% correction from 2025 highs has led to a consolidation phase with ETF outflows and cautious institutional demand, potentially lasting until mid-2026 influenced by U.S. monetary policy.

items.title: JPMorgan Predicts Explosive Crypto Growth by End of 2026
items.summary: JPMorgan remains bullish on the cryptocurrency market despite recent plunges, forecasting significant expansion by the end of 2026.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Backboard.io Leads Both Major AI Memory Benchmarks
items.summary: Backboard.io announced state-of-the-art performance on LongMemEval (93.4% accuracy) and LoCoMo (90.1%), marking the first platform to lead both, advancing agentic AI systems with reliable long-term memory.

items.title: Palo Alto Networks Completes CyberArk Acquisition for AI Identity Security
items.summary: Palo Alto Networks finalized its acquisition of CyberArk to unify security for human, machine, and agentic AI identities, addressing rising threats in cloud and AI environments.

items.title: Khan Academy CEO Warns of AI-Driven Mass Unemployment
items.summary: Khan Academy CEO highlights risks of AI replacing 12% of U.S. workforce per 2025 MIT study, urging reskilling for roles like radiology techs amid predictions of accelerating job displacement.

items.title: Machine Learning Optimizes Plasma Mirror Design for High-Power Lasers
items.summary: University of Strathclyde researchers used machine learning to accelerate optimal design of plasma mirrors, enhancing high-power laser applications.

items.title: MIT Lab Accelerates Material Discovery with AI and Simulations
items.summary: Rafael Gómez-Bombarelli's MIT group combines machine learning, generative AI, and physics simulations to invent new materials, noting an inflection point in AI-driven science.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hinterland Confirms Layoffs After Delaying The Long Dark Sequel
items.summary: Hinterland Studio has laid off 10 full-time employees following the delay of its sequel Blackfrost to The Long Dark. Studio founder Raphael van Lierop announced the news directly.

items.title: Analysts Critique Ubisoft's Cost-Cutting and 'Sustainable Growth' Myth
items.summary: Analysts discuss Ubisoft's major restructuring, including game cancellations, layoffs, and studio reorganization into five creative houses amid ongoing strikes by employees demanding leadership changes. Unions are striking since February 10 over management decisions.

items.title: Five Xbox Games Set for Delisting in February and March 2026
items.summary: Xbox will delist SunnySide (February TBD), Yakuza 3 Remastered (February 12), and three others in the coming weeks.

items.title: Circana Forecasts 3% Rise in U.S. Video Game Spending to $62.8B in 2026
items.summary: U.S. video game industry spending is projected to increase 3% to $62.8 billion in 2026, exceeding the 2021 record of $61.7 billion.

items.title: Germany's 'Press Start' Grant Spurs 75 New Game Studios
items.summary: The 'Press Start: Games Founding Grant' has led to the creation of 75 new games companies in Germany, boosting the local industry.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: US House Defies Trump on Canada Tariffs
items.summary: The US House of Representatives moved to end Trump's Canada tariffs, marking a significant rebuke of the administration's trade policy amid growing midterm anxieties.

items.title: NATO Launches 'Arctic Sentry' Mission Over Greenland
items.summary: NATO has launched a new Arctic security mission in response to rising Russian military activity and China's growing interest in the region, with Germany deploying Eurofighter jets. Russia has warned of potential military countermeasures.

items.title: Waymo Co-CEO Eyes One Million Weekly Robotaxi Rides
items.summary: Waymo's co-CEO outlined ambitious expansion plans targeting one million weekly robotaxi rides as the autonomous vehicle company scales operations.

items.title: Neuralink Brain Chip Trials Progress
items.summary: Elon Musk's Neuralink brain chip continues clinical trials with potential future applications in medical treatment and human-computer interfaces.

items.title: Formula 1 2026 Season Testing Begins with New Regulations
items.summary: F1 teams including Audi, McLaren, and Ferrari have begun Bahrain testing for the 2026 season, featuring significant technical changes and new sidepod designs.
